title: "His Final Thoughts"
body:
Hi, I am the type of person to go hiking a lot and so naturally I tend to find many objects (mostly trash) on my ventures but one day I found an old, weathered book. Out of curiosity, I opened it. I have no idea what to do about the horrors I found in this book will definitely change my life forever. Heres a brief excerpt of the horrors I found in the final pages of this unfinished journal.

"June 27, 1987

Today I went on a hike in an uncharted area around my campsite, I got an overall weird vibe from a specific area near the outskirts of my camp. It was probably nothing but I really don't feel like ever going back to that place. Anyways other than that, today was a very uneventful day."

"June 29, 1987

Today something weird happened, but I'll get into that later. The reason I haven't written for the past few days is that I misplaced my journal, even though I swear I put it in the same place every day. Anyways, the abnormal thing that happened today is that I found what looked like old, crusted blood splattered on a tree near the strange part of the woods. I don't know, It was probably my imagination but I could have sworn it was blood. And yes, I did go back to that part woods but it was because I felt like I needed to investigate."

"July 6, 1987

Yet again, I misplaced my journal again, except for much longer this time. I'm starting to notice other things besides misplacing my journal very often, for example, I'll feel a dark presence in my room at night and also I'll catch the flash of eyes reflecting the light coming from my cabin in the treeline. I'm really starting to consider heading home early because of this."

"July 15, 1987

At this point, I shouldn't have to state why I haven't written in almost ten days, I've started to have a sort of sick feeling in the pit of my stomach, like the way you fell when you know something bad is going to happen. I've been having horrific, vivid nightmares recently but yet I can't help falling asleep so easily I honestly don't even feel like going into the woods anymore, I've decided to go home early, I'll pack up in about two weeks."

"July 28, 1987

I'm supposed to pack up and head home tomorrow and of course, my journal has been missing since the last time I wrote an entree. I'm going to skip the pleasantries... I'm going to die tonight, I know it, "Bradley 1969-1987" was carved into my chest when I woke up. Consider this my final thought, See you guys around."

I didn't know what to think at first, eyes In the woods? vivid nightmares? that sounds absolutely haunting. I noted the presence of dried blood on the page, "Wow, did I really do such a sloppy job that he bled so much?" I remember asking myself, also I didn't realize my part of the woods gave people such a bad vibe. I might have to start using a different sleep medication on my victims, the side effects of eyes in the woods and vivid nightmares horrified me.
author: Ciananman
